page.title: 03FARMING IN LEVEN
page.content: The low lying fertile land makes ideal conditions for the growing of cereal crops. Wheat & Barley predominate, Oil seed Rape is also grown along with some root crops & peas. Leven has several farms some specialise in milk production, others in arable crops, while a few rear pigs & sheep. We visited a typical small mixed livestock farm. It comprises 11 acres, which are divided into paddocks for sheep rearing. The flock is the Horsley flock of pedigree Oxford Down, established in 1899, the farmer being the third generation to have them. In addition he has 70 sows, 3 boars & over 300 piglets & weaners (cross_breds). The work on the farm is done by both the farmer & his wife in partnership. He also teaches for two days at the Bishop Burton College of Agriculture.
